result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah D Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Kidnapping/Seize or Confine w/o Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay  DNA surcharge, all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessment.  To be paid from up to 25% of defendant's prison wages/any amounts provided in Wis. stats Sec. 973.05(4)(b), 303.01(18) & 973.20 while the defendant is in their control/Extended supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo a mental health evaluation and any treatment deemed appropriate.

No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
No conduct rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with the victims.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab under 973.046 & 973.047.
Defendant may not possess a firearm or body armor at any time in the future Sec. 973.29 Wis. stats makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm or body armor, carrying with it it's own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000.00 fine or both.
Court advised defendan tthat his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored 973.176(2).
Pursuant to 973.048 defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Per Remittitur dated April 10, 2019, Appeal No. 2017AP000501 CRNM (2013CF004730), 2017AP000502 CRNM (2013CF004801), 2017AP000504 CRNM (2014CF001147), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on October 3, 2018, that: 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction and the order deying postconviction relief are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney John T. Wasielewski is relieved from further representing Isaiah D. Jordan in these appeals.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated April 9, 2019, Appeal No. 2017AP501-CRNM (2013CF4730), 2017AP502-CRNM (2013CF4801) and 2017AP504-CRNM (2014CF1147), IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

per order dated October 31, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2017AP501-CRNM (2013CF4730), 2017AP502-CRNM (2013CF4801) and 2017AP504-CRNM (2014CF1147), IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied. The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged. First Wisconsin National Bank of Madison v. Nicholaou, 87 Wis. 2d 360, 274 N. W. 2d 704 (1979); IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. Rule 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by December 3, 2018. If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed. No further time extensions will be granted.

per order dated October 3, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2017AP501-CRNM (2013CF4730), 2017AP502-CRNM (2013CF4801) and 2017AP504-CRNM (2014CF1147), IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction and the order denying postconviction relief are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney John T. Wasielewski is relieved from further representing Isaiah D. Jordan in these appeals. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated January 24, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2017AP501-CRNM (2013CF4730), 2017AP502-CRNM (2013CF4801) and 2017AP204-CRNM (2014CF1147), IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for filing a response to the no-merit report is extended to March 26, 2018. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney John T. Wasielewski shall serve a copy of the transcript and circuit court case record on Jordan no later than February 8, 2018, and shall file a letter in this court indicating that service has been made. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(1)(d) (2015-16).

Stat. Rule 809.32.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the appeals in case Nos. 2017AP501-CRNM, 2017AP502-CRNM, and 2017AP504-CRNM are consolidated for briefing and disposition purposes.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for filing a no-merit report in Appeal Nos. 2017AP501-CRNM, 2017AP502-CRNM, and 2017AP504-CRNM is extended through June 16, 2017.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Jordan is relieved of the obligation to file the memorandum required by our order of April 21, 2017.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah D Jordan in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Defendant Isaiah D Jordan in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 7 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 5 YEARS with credit for 1 day time served.  Defendant shall serve 2 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Defendant is required to provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab under 973.046 & 973.047.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of the defendant's prison wages and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Defendant may not possess a firearm or body armor at any time in the future- sec. 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm or body armor, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.  
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  973.176(2)
- Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- No conduct rising to the level of probable cause.
- Undergo a mental health evaluation and any treatment deemed appropriate.
- No contact with the victims.
- Seek and maintain employment.
- DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of 25% of any amounts provided in Wis. Stats., sec. 973.05(4)(b), 303.01(18) & 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Letter dated 10-17-14 for sentencing received and filed./ds

Defendant Isaiah D Jordan in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Defendant Isaiah D Jordan in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court by 11-6-14.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.  Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
